results.title: Basic strokes
results.creator_credit: Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Shot in both still and fast moving water, shows all the simple skills needed to paddle a canoe. Shows forward strokes, sculling draw, slap support, sculling for support, reverse paddle, sweep stroke, draw stroke, low telemark and hanging draw.

results.title: Making of Bush Mechanics
results.brief_description: The Australian landscape is never just a setting. It’s meditative, motivational and menacing; a character that empowers, intimidates and inspires. This artwork examines how representations of Australian landscapes have evolved from being dominated by the Outback to the suburbs and cities.
results.description:
Australia’s First Peoples are connected to Country through thousands of generations of kinship ties. We derive our identity, culture, law and knowledge from Country – something we express and uphold through moving image storytelling. Through the screen, we’re able to tell our story of survival against the violence of colonisation, ensuring our connection and re-connection to Country endures from the past to today.

The Australian landscape is never just a setting. It’s meditative, motivational and menacing; a character that empowers, intimidates and inspires. For years, the Outback has dominated Australian screen stories, but representations have sprawled into the suburbs and cities, creating compelling and complex characters on our screens.
description_for_label:

results.title: Derek Ibbotson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
Shows Derek Ibbotson, the famous British mile runner training, competing and relaxing in his private life.

results.title: Judy Grinham
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
The swimming career of Judy Grinham turned on her decision, when only twelve years of age, to concentrate on her backstroke, and on her partnership with the great swimming coach, Reg Laxton. Shows her racing performance in the 1956 Melbourne Olympics and the 1958 Commonwealth Games and a glimpse of her private life as well.

results.title: Courtney Jones and Doreen Denny
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
Britain’s amateur ice-dancing champions of the world. Shows their graceful partnership in competition events and in nightly practice on a London rink; and in their daily jobs as dress designer and salesperson.

results.title: Pat Smythe
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
A film portrait of Pat Smythe, one of the world’s finest show jumpers. A self-taught rider, she has had incredible success in Olympic, international and British jumping events.; three times British sports woman of the year and was awarded an OBE at Buckingham Place. Her own brilliant horsemanship is illustrated. Her spare time is filled with running a guest-house and writing books on horsemanship.

results.title: John Surtees
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
Motor-cycling champion John Surtees in action during different races, and off the track. Shows the strict routine and precision checking behind a race, several races, Surtees at work as an engineer and his family’s contribution to his success, and finally, his transfer to four-wheel (Formula 2) auto racing.

results.title: Fred Winter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
A film portrait of Fred Winter, one of Britain’s leading steeplechase jockeys. Fred started riding at the age of four; now in his thirties, his outstanding career has seen him winner of the Grand National, twice winner of the Champion Hurdle, and four times Champion Jockey. Sequences show him in action during races, at home with his wife and children in consultation with a trainer.
